body:
@apaszke I disagree. Let's recall your example:
```py
z = torch.ones(...)
with torch.no_grad():
  x = z[0]
x[i] = y
```
Here `y` only interacts with `z` via `x`. So it doesn't make much sense to me to treat as if the `no_grad()` block didn't happen because `x` is defined in that block.
